newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - October 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - October 8.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Navy arrests 109 people trying to flee to India by boat from Mannar because of shortages of food and medicine.
Justice Minister G.L. Peiris says World Bank concedes Sri Lanka's controversial subsidy schemes have contributed significantly to island's advances in health and education.
U.K. cautions LTTE support group, United Tamil Organisation, over fund-raising campaign.
Justice Ministry ponders system of suspended criminal prosecutions to overcome backlog of cases in local courts.
Small cement ship sinks off Negombo coast; seven crewmen rescued, three missing.
Goods and Services Tax bill, which will replace cumbersome turnover tax on imports, manufacturing and services, to be presented to parliament this week.
Police arrest 30 suspects believed to have supported Tamil Tiger rebel suicide bombers in Colombo.
